values.text: Sorry, I don't know how to handle that.
Mitch is the reason why I don't know the answer
Here's a link to our Product Overview. In it you will learn about the basic features available in Watson Assistant.
If there is a feature you'd like to see in Watson Assistant that isn't available, we'd love to hear from you. Check out this link to let us know: IBM Data and AI aha Ideas

Adding Dialog Nodes is performed from the Dialog tab within a skill.

Information about how to add, move, and populate Dialog Nodes on this page is documented at this link: Dialog Overview.

How much does a hipster weigh?
An Instagram!
No problem I guess
Yeah whatever
Sure thing
Of course, I exist for this.
Yes, I'm here silly human
I serve at your pleasure
At your service
hello there.
Hi!
Ok, I understand that you already tried creating a ticket. Would you like me to put you in touch with a human to try to resolve the issue instead?
Have you tried following the instructions here: <upgrade link>
If that still doesn't work, I can get a human to help you.
If none of these articles help, you can open a Support Case to get in touch with a human.

Entities are the 'nouns' that inform Intents.

You can learn more about adding them to your Assistant at this link: Creating Entities.

You can extend the functionality of your Assistant by creating webhook callouts to your dialog nodes.

This Beta feature is described in detail at this link: Adding a webhook callout to a dialog node

To add an existing skill to your Assistant, you can import it as a JSON file.

See here for details on how to do this: Creating a Dialog Skill
You can check out available integrations at this link: Adding Integrations

Currently, speech integration is not a built in function of Watson Assistant.

However, Here's a tutorial on how to leverage Watson Speech to Text and Text to Speech to Enhance your Watson Assistant with Speech capabilities: Voicebot Code Pattern from IBM Developer

dialog_nodes.title: Log Data Information

values.text:
You can use log data information to improve your Assistant based on data collected from every conversation it has.

With PREMIUM instances, these logfiles can be shared across instances.

This documentation link has the details: Improving your Skills using built in Analytics

dialog_nodes.user_label: Using Log Data to improve your Assistant's Skills

values.text:
The number of skills you can create depends on your Watson Assistant plan type.

This link has the details: Skill Limits by plan type

dialog_nodes.title: Beta Program Request

values.text: Follow this link to find out how to join our Beta program: Participate in the beta program

dialog_nodes.user_label: Request to be in Beta Program

values.text: HTTP response codes in the 2xx range indicate success. A response in the 4xx range is some sort of failure, and a response in the 5xx range usually indicates an internal system error that cannot be resolved by the user
If you have a further question about an API response error, you can get in touch with a human below.

dialog_nodes.title: Cloud Foundry to IAM/Resource Group Migration

values.text: Here how to migrate from Cloud Foundry to Resource Groups: Migrating from Cloud Foundry

dialog_nodes.user_label: Migration from Cloud Foundry to Resource Groups

values.text: The various plans available to you are in our Catalog here: Watson Assistant Catalog Listing
Ok, no worries!
Access the logs via Improve tab or API
If you want to learn more, read it here: Assistant Logs Documentation
I'm sorry you're having trouble creating a case. Let me put you in touch with someone who can help.
It seems like you want information on using our APIs. This is a link to our documentation that might help: Watson Assistant API Overview
I'm sorry you're having trouble with importing. Let me see if a human can help you.

dialog_nodes.title: User wants to know how Watson Learns

values.text:
Watson Assistant uses advanced Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning Techniques under the covers that are too complicated to explain here.

Here is a link to the Watson Assistant Overview that will help you to understand the overall process you will follow to create your chatbot virtually without any code!
Ok, I understand that your prior chat was disconnected. A human should be able to help you out here.

Context, and the "context variables" it contains persist throughout a conversation.

Learn more about what they are and how to implement them at this link Accessing Context Data
I'm sorry this isn't working for you, let me put you in touch with a human to help.

dialog_nodes.title: Deploying Watson

values.text:
Deploying (or Integrating) your Assistant isn't complicated. There are even built-in integrations for popular channels like Facebook Messenger, Slack, and others.

See more at this link in our Documentation: Integrating/Deploying your Assistant

dialog_nodes.user_label: Documentation on getting started with Deploying/Integrations

values.text: I can't help open a ticket for you yet, so I'll need to connect you with a human to help.

dialog_nodes.title: Find Node, Workspace, Skill, Assistant IDs

values.text:
To see the Assistant ID, navigate to the Assistants Tab, then Options (three vertical dots on right of each Assistant Instance), then choose Settings, then API Details.
br>
To see the Skill or Workspace ID, navigate to the Skills Tab, then Options (three vertical dots on top right of each Skill Instance), then choose View API Details

To see Node ID, open the exported JSON for a skill and search for the ID referred to in the error message and refer to the "user_label" corresponding to the Node ID to identify the node requiring attention.

dialog_nodes.user_label: How to find the Node, Workspace, Skill, Assistant corresponding to an ID

values.text: Sorry, I only understand English but let me find a human that can help you out!

dialog_nodes.title: Information Security (GPDR etc.)

values.text: If you are interested in learning more about Watson Assistant's Information Security please see this link Watson Assistant Information Security

dialog_nodes.user_label: Documentation on Watson Assistant Information Security

values.text: Arg, training errors are the worst! I'm going to escalate this to try to see what's going on.

Hi there!

I can help answer questions you may have about Watson Assistant.

Quickly start with one of our options below or type your question in.
